column4: so i installed ubuntu on my buddy's HP desktop.  i'm getting these weird errors "BUG: soft lockup - CPU#0 stuck for 11s!"  then it looks like a "tainted" process...
what kernel version is it using?
i think 2.26.19... it's kinda freakin out
there are one or two BUG issues in rare cases, do a search on https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/ - you might find one that matches
hrm... this system really doesn't seem to like ubuntu.  livecd didn't boot, alternate install failed and the minimal install worked but these soft locks are strange
sorry pavilion a1220n.  i can't read.
From what I can see, both those models are trouble, I'm afraid
From what I am reading it's got a broken IRQ configuration amongst other things
so there's nothing i can do?  i was really touting ubuntu to this guy, and he's really sick of winblows... it'd be a real shame if this doesn't work out at all.
Also, it seems the same model number covers two sets of hardware, one Intel 32-bit, one AMD64 !
so... is there nothing i can do?  i don't understand what is so horridly wrong with this system i can't run ubuntu...
I don't know, try Googling for clues
i have... i didn't find anything about IRQ's or anything like that so i figured you were onto something haha
